required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Tysabri (Natalizumab) in Patients Who Failed Anti-TNF-α Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IV, Open-Label Study of Tysabri (Natalizumab) in Patients Who Failed Anti-TNF-α Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate the safety, tolerability and clinical benefit of TYSABRI® (natalizumab) in patients with moderately to severely active Crohn's disease.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study sponsor decided to withdraw the current study prior to enrollment of first participant.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion (%) achieving a clinical response at Week 12, defined as a reduction in the CDAI score from baseline (Week 0) of ≥ 70 points.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion (%) achieving a clinical remission at each visit, defined as a CDAI score < 150
Proportion achieving clinical response at Week 4 and Week 8
Proportion achieving a ≥ 100 point decrease in baseline (Week 0) CDAI score at each visit
